security: Revealing the identities of individuals who were interviewed and provided information to intelligence agencies could compromise their safety or create risks for ongoing or future investigations.
summary: An agent report details an interview with a soldier, Peter D. Herpst, regarding a possible counter-intelligence interest involving an individual named John Dee Jay inquiring about former unit members and mentioning a 'package' for Cristobal Pimentel-Davilla.
summary_one_paragraph: This agent report, dated February 4, 1972, recounts an interview with Peter D. Herpst, a clerk at C Team in Datteln, Germany, who reported being approached by an individual known as John Dee Jay. Dee Jay inquired about the whereabouts of former unit members, specifically Cristobal Pimentel-Davilla, and mentioned having a 'package' for him. Herpst suspected the package contained drugs, as Pimentel-Davilla was known to use and possibly sell hashish or marijuana. The report includes a description of Dee Jay and notes that Pimentel-Davilla had recently been transferred to Fort Eustis, Virginia.
title: Agent Report
